creator: marc@iacomputing.co.uk
text: I had a problem with my apache server the other day harbouring a 60GB log file - so big I can't even open it. Turns out it's a very common problem. It got me thinking it would be useful to have a maximum_log_file_size setting within apache. So that when a log reaches maximum size, it removes the oldest entries and appends the new ones.

creator: poirier@pobox.com
text: Such a feature already exists.  Search the doc for "rotatelogs".
